title: where are they now and where else have we seen them?
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Clueless’ most famous face celebrates her 43rd birthday this month, making it 24 years since the film released in July 1996.

The film defined an entire generation as it introduced us to the rich kids of Beverly Hills and changed the wardrobe of girls everywhere as plaid, knee socks and bouncing blowdry became the new ‘uniform’ for teens worldwide.

And now, as the film’s star Alicia Silverstone celebrates her birthday, we take a look at what Cher Horowitz and the rest of the Bronson Alcott High School class of ’95 have been doing since the fateful day she caught the bouquet at her teacher’s wedding.

From style icon Cher to her naive classmate Tai, here’s a breakdown of what the stars have been up to over the past two decades.

(Image: Paramount Pictures)

Alicia Silverstone

Born on October 4, 1976, the now 43-year-old actress, who played Cher Horowitz, has had a successful career on both the big and small screens.

After Clueless, Alicia snapped up a multimillion dollar deal with Columbia pictures, and went on to play BatGirl in the 1997 blockbuster Batman & Robin.

The same year, she established her own production company, with Excess Baggage the first release under her own banner.

She received a Golden Globe nomination for Best Actress - TV Series Musical or Comedy for her role in the short-lived NBC series Miss Match in 2003.

However, she then took a step back from TV and big-budget films, and chose to focus on smaller-scale movies and theatre projects.

(Image: WireImage)

In 2018, the actress appeared in the comedy Book Club opposite Diane Keaton, Jane Fonda and Candice Bergen, playing the "domineering" daughter of a "skittish" widow reading Fifty Shades of Grey.

She later starred in American Woman, playing a woman discovering her own brand of independence amid the rise of second-wave feminism in the 1970.

Alicia went on to appear in the horror film The Lodge, which premiered at the 2019 Sundance Film Festival.

Alicia runs a website dedicated to vegan eating and environmental awareness, and has also published a vegan cookbook entitled ‘The Kind Diet’.

She married musician Christopher Jarecki in 2005, welcoming son Bear Blu in 2011, but the pair filed for divorce in 2018.

(Image: Paramount Pictures)

Stacey Dash

Stacey played Cher’s best friend Dionne Marie Davenport in the Clueless film, and reprised her role for the spin-off TV series too which came to an end in 1999.

Since then she’s kept busy with numerous film projects, TV shows and music videos.

In 2013, Stacey launched the web series Stacey Dash Is Normal, and frequently appears as guest commentator on Fox News.

(Image: Getty Images)

The mum-of-two, who has been married four times, was arrested for alleged domestic violence in September 2019 after reportedly getting into a physical altercation with her fourth husband Jeffrey Marty at their Florida home.

According to TMZ the star “pushed him and slapped his face” during the argument, leaving him with “red scratch marks” on his left arm, but he bailed her out of jail shortly after.

Brittany Murphy

Brittany played the character of Tai Frasier, a bubbly and naive schoolgirl, in the Clueless film.

The highly praised performance landed her roles in 8 Mile, Uptown Girls, Just Married and Sin City.

She was also a budding musician, and her dance single with Paul Oakenfold, “Faster Kill Pussycat,” reached Number One on Billboard‘s dance chart.

She married writer and director Simon Monjack in 2007, but tragically died in 2009 of cardiac arrest. She was just 32.

Her cause of death was officially recorded as pneumonia.

Her husband was found dead at the home they shared in 2010, with his cause of death recorded as acute pneumonia and severe anemia.

(Image: Getty Images for Maui Film Festi)

Paul Rudd

Paul played Cher’s ex-stepbrother turned love interest Josh in the film.

The actor’s career later saw him play Mike Hannigan in Friends, before landing roles in some of the biggest comedies of the last decade.

Paul’s appeared in Anchorman, The 40-Year-Old Virgin, Knocked Up and This Is 40, and had a memorable arc as Bobby Newport in Parks and Recreation.

Not one to sit back and take it easy, he’s also taken on the role of a superhero by playing Ant-Man in Avengers: Endgame.

He married Julie Yaeger in 2003, and welcomed son Jack in 2006 and daughter Darby in 2010.

(Image: Paramount Pictures)

(Image: Getty Images)

Donald Faison

Like his on-screen girlfriend Dionne, Donald also reprised his role for the Clueless TV spin-off.

He also had small but memorable roles in Waiting to Exhale, Uptown Girls, and Josie and the Pussycats.

However, he is most famous for playing Dr. Chris Turk on Scrubs for nine seasons.

He went on to star in sitcom The Exes, before hosting the TBS comedy-sketch show Who Gets the Last Laugh.

The twice-married star has six kids from multiple relationships.

(Image: Paramount Pictures)

(Image: FilmMagic)

Elisa Donavan

Elisa is best known for coining the “whatever” hand gesture, made iconic by her character Amber.

After reprising the role for the Clueless spin-off, she went on to star in A Night at the Roxbury, Beverly Hills, 90210 and played Morgan Cavanaugh on Sabrina the Teenage Witch.

A popular parenting blogger, Elisa married Charlie Bigelow in 2012, and the pair have one daughter.

(Image: WireImage)

Wallace Shawn

Wallace played high school teacher Mr. Alphonse Hall, who went on to fall in love with Miss Geist.

Since then, the accomplished actor and playwright has appeared in everything from The Incredibles and BoJack Horseman to Gossip Girl and Toy Story.

In 2005, he was named a Master American Dramatist by the PEN/Laura Pels International Foundation, and he often appears on MSNBC as a political commentator.

More recently, he can be seen as Dr John Sturgis in the sitcom Young Sheldon.

description: The iconic film first hit screens in 1996 and inspired a new generation of plaid wearing schoolgirls across the world
authors: Getty Images For Maui Film Festi
